a.h1: Waterford USD Waterford Unified School District

li.a: Title IX: Sex Equity in Education
Waterford Unified School District: At-Home Learning Packets

div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.p:
As students engage in online resources, we strongly recommend that parents/guardians remain informed regarding digital safety, including student privacy. Please take a look at this short video for some simple reminders about keeping kids safe online:
6 Ways Your Kids Can Protect Their Online Identities
Additional Resources:
The Bare Minimum You Should Do to Protect Your Family's Data & Common Sense Media - Privacy and Internet Safety

During school closures, Waterford Unified School District is continuing to monitor the appropriate use of district-issued devices and all student Google account activity. Students using district-issued devices as part of our 1:1 initiative are reminded that devices are provided as a learning tool. All communication within the Waterford domain is monitored, and all communication, including student-to-student, should be appropriate and demonstrate kindness towards others.

p.a: Click here for At-Home Learning Packets by Grade Level

div.p: To access online resources, parents/guardians may be interested in free or affordable internet providers. We offer the following information as a courtesy to our parents/guardians. Please visit this link for information below about multiple internet offers.
During school closures, parents may be looking for affordable internet providers. We offer the following information as a courtesy to our Sylvan parents/guardians.

Internet For All Now: The California Emerging Technology Fund has provided this link to affordable offers as well as a number to call (1-844-841-INFO (4636)) someone who can assist parents: Affordable Internet Offers.

Some cell phone providers are offering the tethering (hotspot) functionality for existing cell phones for free during this time of need. We recommend that parents reach out to their current mobile providers to see what they are offering at this time. Click here for more options.

p.a: For more resources by provider click here.

td.a: Peep and the Big Wide World
